QA.q: Describe the following driving scene concisely, discussing the driver's action and the cause.
QA.a: First, as the car ahead came to a complete stop, the ego-car also comes to a halt. Then, as the car in the front commences to crawl forward, the ego-car mirrors this action by accelerating at a very slow pace. Finally, the ego-car stops once more, this time because the car in front has come to a complete stop to allow pedestrians to cross. Throughout this process, the driver's actions are mainly responsive to the movements of the car directly in front and are influenced by the need to ensure pedestrian safety.
